intro: Guatteria punctata, commonly known as the punctate guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with a distinctive punctuated texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by yellow or red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
